page.title: 09BOVINGDON AIRFIELD
page.content: The airfield was built during the Second World War (1939-1945) and was used for a number of purposes for both the American and British Air Forces. Since it was closed 20 years ago there has been much discussion about its use. Part has gone back to farming land. A section of the runway is now used as a stock car race track. There is often a Sunday market on the field and at Bank Holiday weekends there are other special events and rallies. The most controversial plan is for a prison to be built on a large part of the field. The building of this is now well advanced and opening is planed for 1986 or 1987.
